info.name: Phase 2 GC02 - Blog Management API
info.description: Comprehensive API collection for a blog management system with authentication, user management, and blog content operations. This API supports role-based access control (Admin, Staff, User) and provides both authenticated and public endpoints for blog content.

item.name: Authentication

request.description: Authenticate user and receive JWT token. Returns user profile and access token for subsequent API calls.

urlencoded.description: User role: Admin, Staff, or User (defaults to Staff)

request.description: Create a new user account. Requires admin authentication. Creates user with specified role and returns user profile with JWT token.

item.description: User authentication and management endpoints. Includes login functionality and user creation (admin only).

item.name: System Management

request.description: Check application health status including uptime, environment, and version information. Public endpoint with no authentication required.
Retrieve general application information including name, version, description, and available endpoints. Public endpoint with no authentication required.

query.description: Seed operation type: seed, re-seed, or empty (default: seed)

request.description: Populate database with initial data. Requires secret seed code for security. Use 'seed' to add data, 're-seed' to clear and repopulate, or 'empty' to clear all data.

query.description: Clear existing data and repopulate with fresh seed data

request.description: Clear all existing data and repopulate database with fresh seed data. This operation will permanently delete all current data and replace it with initial data.

query.description: Empty all data from database tables

request.description: Remove all data from database tables. This operation will permanently delete all data including users, blog posts, categories, companies, and job postings. Use with extreme caution.

item.description: System management and utility endpoints including health checks, application info, and database seeding operations.

item.name: Blog Management

request.description: Retrieve all blog posts with author and category information. Requires authentication.
Retrieve detailed information for a specific blog post including author and category details.

    "content": "As we move into 2024, the debate between React and Vue.js continues to evolve. Both frameworks have matured significantly, offering developers powerful tools for building modern web applications. React maintains its position as the most popular framework, backed by Meta's continuous investment and a vast ecosystem. Meanwhile, Vue.js has gained traction with its gentle learning curve and excellent documentation.

React's strength lies in its flexibility and the robust ecosystem of libraries and tools. The introduction of React 18 with concurrent features has further solidified its position. On the other hand, Vue 3's Composition API brings a more functional approach while maintaining the framework's renowned simplicity.

Performance-wise, both frameworks are highly optimized. React's virtual DOM and Vue's reactivity system both deliver excellent user experiences. The choice often comes down to team expertise, project requirements, and long-term maintainability considerations.

In conclusion, both frameworks will continue to thrive in 2024, serving different needs in the development ecosystem.",

body.raw:
{
    "title": "The Future of Web Development: React vs Vue in 2024 (Updated)",
    "content": "As we move into 2024, the debate between React and Vue.js continues to evolve with exciting new developments. Both frameworks have matured significantly, offering developers powerful tools for building modern web applications.

React maintains its position as the most popular framework, backed by Meta's continuous investment and a vast ecosystem. The recent updates to React 18 have introduced groundbreaking concurrent features that revolutionize how we think about rendering and user experience.

Meanwhile, Vue.js has gained significant traction with its gentle learning curve and excellent documentation. Vue 3's Composition API brings a more functional approach while maintaining the framework's renowned simplicity and developer-friendly approach.

Performance benchmarks show both frameworks delivering exceptional results. React's virtual DOM reconciliation and Vue's fine-grained reactivity system both ensure optimal user experiences across different application scales.

The choice between these frameworks often comes down to team expertise, project requirements, ecosystem needs, and long-term maintainability considerations. Both will continue to thrive and evolve in 2024.",
    "imgUrl": "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1633356122102-3fe601e05bd2?w=1200",
    "categoryId": 1
}

request.description: Update an existing blog post. Requires Staff/Admin role and ownership of the post (or Admin override).

formdata.description: Image file to upload (JPEG, PNG, WebP supported)

variable.description: Blog post ID to update image for

request.description: Upload and update the featured image for a blog post. Image will be automatically optimized and stored in Cloudinary. Requires ownership or Admin role.
Permanently delete a blog post. Requires Staff/Admin role and ownership of the post (or Admin override). This action cannot be undone.
Retrieve all blog categories available in the system. Requires authentication.
Retrieve detailed information for a specific category including associated blog posts.

urlencoded.description: Category name (2-100 characters, must be unique)

request.description: Create a new blog category. Requires Admin role. Category names must be unique across the system.
Update an existing blog category. Requires Admin role. Updated name must remain unique.
Delete a blog category. Requires Admin role. Cannot delete categories that have associated blog posts.

query.description: Sort order: ASC or DESC (default: DESC)

Retrieve detailed information for a specific blog post including author and category information. Public access, no authentication required.
Retrieve all available blog categories for public use. Useful for building category filters and navigation. No authentication required.

item.description: Public endpoints for blog content consumption. No authentication required.
Protected blog content management endpoints. Requires authentication and appropriate permissions.
